result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel P. Rodriguez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel P. Rodriguez

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: Amy. 
Called:  2:52 p.m. 
INCLUDES 22CM159, 22CM551, 22CT158.
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo for ADA Zibolski. 
Defendant appears in custody from MCJ with Atty Paige Metzman. 

Date and time set for SAR hearing (22CM159) and plea/sentencing on remaining cases; VRCW. 

22CM159 Revocation>>
Parties stipulate to sentence; ADA Mayo recites agreement for record. 
COURT ORDERS: 
Count 2 (Disorderly Conduct/DA)>>90 days MCJ; Court grants 119 days credit.  Any outstanding financial obligations are converted to civil judgment.

22CM551 and 22CT158>>
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.

22CT158>>State moves to DRI Count 1 (Operate w/o Valid License); COURT grants. 

22CM551>>State moves to DRI Count 2 (Disorderly Conduct/Domestic Abuse); COURT grants. 

PLEA: 

22CM551 Count 1 (Battery/Domestic Abuse)>>NO CONTEST.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty.

COURT ORDERS: 6 months MCJ.  Court costs including DNA sample/surcharge including Domestic Abuse surcharge.  COURT grants 115 days credit.  

Adj:  3:03 p.m.
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 7, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

records.addlTxt:
Indigency hearing on June 23, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on August 24, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Final pre-trial on October 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury Trial on November 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

INCLUDES 22CM551 & 22CT158.  No contact with victim(s):  N.J.V-O.  or their residence.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Police escort to retrieve personal property from residence - Wausau PD.  Third party exchange through Family Resource Center. Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol and controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed. Shall not drive a motor vehicle without valid driver's license.   Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept. Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (3) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

Case Called: 2:12 pm
INCLUDES 22CM551 & 22CT158.
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Lacey Coonen in person for ADA Natalie Zibolski Defendant appears in custody, via Zoom Video, and with Atty Peter Vu in person.

VRCW.  
Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel. 
PLEA:  NOT GUILTY.

BOND: 
$10,000 Signature Bond. 

CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s): N.J.V-O. or their residence.
- Police escort to retrieve personal property from the residence-Wausau PD. 
- 3rd party child exchange through the family resource center. 
- Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol and controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.  
- No driving without valid DL. 
- Prints and photograph. 
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 3 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.  

DATES:
